SEARCH
Package com.ilm.projecto_ilm_backend.bean

Class ProjectBean

java.lang.Object
com.ilm.projecto_ilm_backend.bean.ProjectBean
public class ProjectBean extends Object
The ProjectBean class is responsible for managing ProjectEntity instances. It is a singleton bean, meaning there is a single instance for the entire application.

    • createDefaultProjectsIfNotExistent

      public void createDefaultProjectsIfNotExistent()
      Creates default projects if they do not already exist. This method initializes a predefined number of projects with default values.

      Parameters:
      userResponsable - The user responsible for the final presentation task.
      projectSystemName - The system name of the project.

      userResponsable - The user responsible for the task.
      systemTitle - The system title of the task.

      Generates a system name for a project based on its original name.
      Parameters:
      originalName - The original name of the project.
      Returns:
      The generated system name.

    • createDefaultUsersInProjectIfNotExistent

      public void createDefaultUsersInProjectIfNotExistent()
      Creates default users in projects if they do not already exist. This method initializes a predefined number of users in projects with default values.

    • getProjectsDtosHome

      public ArrayList<HomeProjectDto> getProjectsDtosHome()
      Retrieves a list of project DTOs for the home page.
      Returns:
      A list of HomeProjectDto instances.

    • getProjectTableInfo

      public ProjectTableInfoDto getProjectTableInfo(String sessionId, int page, String labName, String status, boolean slotsAvailable, String nameAsc, String statusAsc, String labAsc, String startDateAsc, String endDateAsc, String keyword)
      Retrieves information for the project table.
      Parameters:
      sessionId - The session ID of the user.
      page - The page number to retrieve.
      labName - The name of the lab.
      status - The status of the project.
      slotsAvailable - Whether the project has available slots.
      nameAsc - Sort by name ascending.
      statusAsc - Sort by status ascending.
      labAsc - Sort by lab ascending.
      startDateAsc - Sort by start date ascending.
      endDateAsc - Sort by end date ascending.
      keyword - The keyword to search for.
      Returns:
      A ProjectTableInfoDto instance containing the project table information.

    • getMyProjectsPageInfo

      public ProjectTableInfoDto getMyProjectsPageInfo(String sessionId, int page, String labName, String status, String keyword, String type)
      Retrieves information for the user's projects.
      Parameters:
      sessionId - The session ID of the user.
      page - The page number to retrieve.
      labName - The name of the lab.
      status - The status of the project.
      keyword - The keyword to search for.
      type - The type of user in the project.
      Returns:
      A ProjectTableInfoDto instance containing the user's projects information.

      Returns:
      A list of StateProjectENUM values representing all project statuses.

      public int calculateMaximumPageTableProjects(int numberOfProjects, int numberOfProjectPerPage)
      Calculates the maximum page number for the project table.
      Parameters:
      numberOfProjects - The total number of projects.
      numberOfProjectPerPage - The number of projects per page.
      Returns:
      The maximum page number.

    • getProjectsToInvite

      public List<ProjectProfileDto> getProjectsToInvite(int userId, String inviteeUsername) throws NoProjectsToInviteException, NoProjectsForInviteeException
      Retrieves a list of project profiles to invite a user to.
      Parameters:
      userId - The ID of the user sending the invitation.
      inviteeUsername - The username of the user to be invited.
      Returns:
      A list of ProjectProfileDto instances representing the projects to invite the user to.
      Throws:
      NoProjectsToInviteException - If there are no projects to invite the user to.
      NoProjectsForInviteeException - If the invitee does not exist.

    • isUserCreatorOrManagerByProjectName

      public boolean isUserCreatorOrManagerByProjectName(int userId, String projectName)
      Checks if a user is either a creator or a manager of a project by project name.
      Parameters:
      userId - The ID of the user to check.
      projectName - The name of the project.
      Returns:
      true if the user is a creator or manager of the project, false otherwise.

    • isUserCreatorOrManager

      public boolean isUserCreatorOrManager(int userId, String projectSystemName)
      Checks if a user is either a creator or a manager of a project by project system name.
      Parameters:
      userId - The ID of the user to check.
      projectSystemName - The system name of the project.
      Returns:
      true if the user is a creator or manager of the project, false otherwise.

    • inviteUserToProject

      public String inviteUserToProject(String sessionId, String systemUsername, String projectName)
      Invites a user to a project. This method checks if the project is not canceled or full, and if the user is not already invited, then sends an invitation.
      Parameters:
      sessionId - The session ID of the user sending the invitation.
      systemUsername - The system username of the user to invite.
      projectName - The name of the project to which the user is being invited.
      Returns:
      A string message indicating the result of the invitation process.

    • acceptInvite

      public String acceptInvite(int userId, String projectName)
      Accepts an invitation to a project. This method checks if the project is not canceled or full, and if so, changes the user's project status to MEMBER_BY_INVITATION.
      Parameters:
      userId - The ID of the user accepting the invitation.
      projectName - The name of the project to which the user was invited.
      Returns:
      A string message indicating the result of the acceptance process.

    • rejectInvite

      public String rejectInvite(int userId, String projectName)
      Rejects an invitation to a project. This method removes the user's pending invitation to the project and sends a notification to the inviter indicating the rejection.
      Parameters:
      userId - The ID of the user rejecting the invitation.
      projectName - The name of the project to which the user was invited.
      Returns:
      A string message indicating the result of the rejection process.

    • getProjectInfoPage

      public ProjectProfilePageDto getProjectInfoPage(int userId, String systemProjectName)
      Retrieves detailed information about a project for display on the project's profile page. This includes project members, skills required for the project, possible states the project can transition to, and the project's progress.
      Parameters:
      userId - The ID of the user requesting the project information.
      systemProjectName - The system name of the project.
      Returns:
      An instance of ProjectProfilePageDto containing detailed information about the project.

    • getProjectMembers

      public List<ProjectMemberDto> getProjectMembers(int projectId)
      Retrieves a list of project members for a given project.
      Parameters:
      projectId - The ID of the project.
      Returns:
      A list of ProjectMemberDto objects representing the members of the project.

    • getAllProjectMembers

      public List<ProjectMemberDto> getAllProjectMembers(int projectId)
      Retrieves a list of all project members, regardless of their role, for a given project.
      Parameters:
      projectId - The ID of the project.
      Returns:
      A list of ProjectMemberDto objects representing all members associated with the project.

    • getProgress

      public int getProgress(int projectId)
      Calculates the progress of a project based on the status of its tasks. The progress is a percentage value representing the completion level of the project.
      Parameters:
      projectId - The ID of the project.
      Returns:
      An integer value representing the project's progress percentage.

    • getUserTypeInProject

      public UserInProjectTypeENUM getUserTypeInProject(int userId, int projectId)
      Determines the type of a user within a project. This can be used to tailor the user interface based on the user's role in the project.
      Parameters:
      userId - The ID of the user.
      projectId - The ID of the project.
      Returns:
      A UserInProjectTypeENUM value representing the user's type within the project.

    • approveOrRejectProject

      public String approveOrRejectProject(String projectSystemName, boolean approve, String reason, int userId, String sessionId)
      Approves or rejects a project based on the provided boolean flag. This method also sends notifications to project members and updates the project's status accordingly.
      Parameters:
      projectSystemName - The system name of the project.
      approve - A boolean flag indicating whether the project is to be approved (true) or rejected (false).
      reason - The reason for rejection, if applicable.
      userId - The ID of the user performing the approval or rejection.
      sessionId - The session ID of the user performing the action.
      Returns:
      A string message indicating the result of the operation.

    • joinProject

      public String joinProject(int userId, String projectSystemName)
      Allows a user to apply to join a project. This method checks if the project exists and is not canceled, and if the user does not already have a record in this project. If all conditions are met, the user's application is recorded, and notifications are sent to the project's team leaders.
      Parameters:
      userId - The ID of the user applying to join the project.
      projectSystemName - The system name of the project the user wants to join.
      Returns:
      A string message indicating the outcome of the application process.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the project does not exist or the user already has a record in this project.
      IllegalStateException - if the project is canceled.

    • cancelProject

      public String cancelProject(int userId, String projectSystemName, String reason, String sessionId)
      Cancels a project. This method checks if the project exists and if the user requesting the cancellation has the necessary permissions. If the conditions are met, the project's status is set to canceled, a reason for the cancellation is recorded, and notifications are sent to all team members.
      Parameters:
      userId - The ID of the user requesting the cancellation.
      projectSystemName - The system name of the project to be canceled.
      reason - The reason for canceling the project.
      sessionId - The session ID of the user requesting the cancellation.
      Returns:
      A string message indicating the outcome of the cancellation process.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the project does not exist or the user is not found.
      UnauthorizedAccessException - if the user does not have permission to cancel the project.

    • markReasonAsRead

      public String markReasonAsRead(int userId, String projectSystemName)
      Marks the cancellation reason of a project as read by a user. This method checks if the project exists and if the user has the necessary permissions to mark the reason as read. If the conditions are met, the cancellation reason is cleared.
      Parameters:
      userId - The ID of the user marking the reason as read.
      projectSystemName - The system name of the project.
      Returns:
      A string message indicating the outcome of the operation.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the project does not exist.
      UnauthorizedAccessException - if the user does not have permission to mark the reason as read.

    • changeProjectState

      public String changeProjectState(int userId, String projectSystemName, StateProjectENUM newState, String reason) throws Exception
      Changes the state of a project. This method checks if the project exists and if the user requesting the change has the necessary permissions. It also validates the new state and, if applicable, records a reason for the change. Notifications are sent to all team members about the state change.
      Parameters:
      userId - The ID of the user requesting the state change.
      projectSystemName - The system name of the project.
      newState - The new state to which the project is to be changed.
      reason - The reason for changing the state, required if the new state is CANCELED.
      Returns:
      A string message indicating the outcome of the state change.
      Throws:
      Exception - if the project does not exist, the user does not have permission, or a cancellation reason is required but not provided.

    • getProjectMembersByProjectId

      public List<UserEntity> getProjectMembersByProjectId(int projectId)
      Retrieves a list of project members by project ID. This method is used internally to fetch the list of users who are members of a specific project.
      Parameters:
      projectId - The ID of the project.
      Returns:
      A list of UserEntity objects representing the members of the project.

    • getProjectCreatorsAndManagersByProjectId

      public List<UserEntity> getProjectCreatorsAndManagersByProjectId(int projectId)
      Retrieves a list of project creators and managers by project ID. This method is used internally to fetch the list of users who are either creators or managers of a specific project.
      Parameters:
      projectId - The ID of the project.
      Returns:
      A list of UserEntity objects representing the creators and managers of the project.

    • removeUserFromProject

      public String removeUserFromProject(String systemProjectName, int userToRemoveId, int currentUserId, String reason, String sessionId)
      Removes a user from a project. This method checks if the project exists, if the user to be removed exists, and if the user requesting the removal has the necessary permissions. If the conditions are met, the user is removed from the project, and notifications are sent to the removed user.
      Parameters:
      systemProjectName - The system name of the project.
      userToRemoveId - The ID of the user to be removed from the project.
      currentUserId - The ID of the user requesting the removal.
      reason - The reason for removing the user from the project.
      sessionId - The session ID of the user requesting the removal.
      Returns:
      A string message indicating the outcome of the removal process.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the project does not exist, the user to be removed is not in the project, or the user to be removed is the creator of the project.
      UnauthorizedAccessException - if the user requesting the removal does not have permission to remove the user.
      IllegalStateException - if the project is in a state that does not allow removal of users.

    • acceptApplication

      public String acceptApplication(String systemProjectName, int userToAccept, int currentUserId, String sessionId)
      Accepts a user's application to join a project. This method verifies the project's existence, the user's pending status, and the project's capacity before changing the user's status to a member. It also sends a notification and an email to the user about the acceptance.
      Parameters:
      systemProjectName - The system name of the project to which the user applied.
      userToAccept - The ID of the user whose application is to be accepted.
      currentUserId - The ID of the current user performing the operation.
      sessionId - The session ID of the current user.
      Returns:
      A string message indicating the outcome of the operation.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If the user is not pending to join the project.
      IllegalStateException - If the project is full, canceled, or ready.

    • rejectApplication

      public String rejectApplication(String systemProjectName, int userToReject, int currentUserId, String reason, String sessionId)
      Rejects a user's application to join a project. This method verifies the project's existence and the user's pending status before removing the user's application. It also sends a notification and an email to the user about the rejection.
      Parameters:
      systemProjectName - The system name of the project to which the user applied.
      userToReject - The ID of the user whose application is to be rejected.
      currentUserId - The ID of the current user performing the operation.
      reason - The reason for rejecting the application.
      sessionId - The session ID of the current user.
      Returns:
      A string message indicating the outcome of the operation.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If the user is not pending to join the project.
      IllegalStateException - If the project is canceled or ready.

    • getProjectMembersPage

      public ProjectMembersPageDto getProjectMembersPage(int currentUserId, String systemProjectName)
      Retrieves the page information of project members for a specific project. This method checks if the project exists and if the current user has the necessary permissions to view the project members.
      Parameters:
      currentUserId - The ID of the current user requesting the information.
      systemProjectName - The system name of the project.
      Returns:
      An instance of ProjectMembersPageDto containing information about the project members.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If the project is not found.
      UnauthorizedAccessException - If the current user is not a creator or manager of the project.

    • isUserCreator

      public boolean isUserCreator(int userId, String projectSystemName)
      Checks if a user is the creator of a project.
      Parameters:
      userId - The ID of the user to check.
      projectSystemName - The system name of the project.
      Returns:
      true if the user is the creator of the project, false otherwise.

    • changeUserInProjectType

      public String changeUserInProjectType(String projectSystemName, int userId, UserInProjectTypeENUM newType, int currentUserId)
      Changes the type of a user in a project. This method verifies the project's existence, the current user's permissions, and the validity of the new type before updating the user's type in the project.
      Parameters:
      projectSystemName - The system name of the project.
      userId - The ID of the user whose type is to be changed.
      newType - The new type to assign to the user.
      currentUserId - The ID of the current user performing the operation.
      Returns:
      A string message indicating the outcome of the operation.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If the project is not found, the new type is invalid, or the user is not in the project.
      UnauthorizedAccessException - If the current user does not have permission to change the user type.

    • createProject

      public boolean createProject(ProjectCreationDto projectCreationInfoDto, String sessionId)
      Creates a new project based on the provided information. This method checks if the project already exists, validates the start and end dates, and then creates a new project entity along with its associated user project entity.
      Parameters:
      projectCreationInfoDto - The DTO containing information for project creation.
      sessionId - The session ID of the user creating the project.
      Returns:
      true if the project is successfully created, false otherwise.
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - If the start date is after the end date or before the current date.

    • getProjectDetails

      public ProjectCreationDto getProjectDetails(String systemProjectName, String sessionId)
      Retrieves detailed information about a project based on its system name and the session ID of the requesting user. This method ensures that only the creator or a manager of the project can view its details. It fetches the project from the database and maps its properties to a ProjectCreationDto object, including name, description, lab location, motivation, start and end dates, photo URL, maximum members, skills required, and keywords associated with the project.
      Parameters:
      systemProjectName - The system name of the project for which details are requested.
      sessionId - The session ID of the user requesting the project details.
      Returns:
      A ProjectCreationDto object containing the detailed information of the project.
      Throws:
      UnauthorizedAccessException - If the user is not the creator or a manager of the project.
      IllegalArgumentException - If the project with the given system name does not exist.

    • updateProject

      public boolean updateProject(ProjectCreationDto projectUpdateDto, String sessionId, String systemProjectName)
      Updates the details of an existing project based on the provided ProjectCreationDto object, session ID, and system project name. This method checks if the project exists and if the user making the request is the creator or a manager of the project. It then updates the project details in the database if the project is not canceled or ready. The method also validates the start and end dates, maximum members, and updates the project's skills and keywords.
      Parameters:
      projectUpdateDto - The DTO containing the updated project details.
      sessionId - The session ID of the user requesting the update.
      systemProjectName - The system name of the project to update.
      Returns:
      true if the project was successfully updated, false otherwise.
      Throws:
      UnauthorizedAccessException - If the user is not the creator or a manager of the project.
      IllegalArgumentException - If the project does not exist or the input data is invalid.

    • uploadProjectPicture

      public boolean uploadProjectPicture(Map<String,String> request, String projectName)
      Handles the upload of a project picture, decoding it from a Base64 string and saving it to the project's directory. The method updates the project entity with URLs to the original and resized images. It checks if the provided Base64 string is not empty and contains the image data, then delegates the saving of the image to the saveProjectPicture method.
      Parameters:
      request - A map containing the Base64 string of the image under the key "file".
      projectName - The name of the project to which the picture will be uploaded.
      Returns:
      true if the picture was successfully uploaded and saved, false otherwise.

    • saveProjectPicture

      public boolean saveProjectPicture(ProjectEntity projectEntity, String base64Image)
      Saves the project picture to the filesystem and updates the project entity with URLs to the original and resized images. This method decodes the Base64 string to an image, determines the image format, and saves the image to the project's specific directory. It also creates resized versions of the image for different purposes.
      Parameters:
      projectEntity - The project entity to which the picture belongs.
      base64Image - The Base64 string of the image.
      Returns:
      true if the image was successfully saved, false otherwise.

    • addInitialMembers

      public boolean addInitialMembers(ProjectCreationMembersDto projectCreationMembersDto, String projectSystemName, String sessionId)
      Adds initial members to a project based on a list of user IDs. This method checks if the number of initial members does not exceed the project's maximum allowed members and the system's configuration. It then adds each user as a member of the project and sends notifications and emails to the added members.
      Parameters:
      projectCreationMembersDto - The DTO containing the list of user IDs to add as initial members and the maximum members allowed for the project.
      projectSystemName - The system name of the project to which members will be added.
      sessionId - The session ID of the user adding the members.
      Returns:
      true if the initial members were successfully added, false otherwise.

    • removeInvitation

      public String removeInvitation(String projectSystemName, int userToRemoveId, int currentUserId, String sessionId)
      Removes an invitation for a user to join a project. This method checks if the user has a pending invitation to the project and removes it. It also sends a notification and an email to the user informing them that the invitation has been removed.
      Parameters:
      projectSystemName - The system name of the project from which the invitation is to be removed.
      userToRemoveId - The ID of the user whose invitation is to be removed.
      currentUserId - The ID of the current user performing the operation.
      sessionId - The session ID of the current user.
      Returns:
      A string message indicating the outcome of the operation.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If the user does not have a pending invitation to the project.

    • addResourcesToProject

      public boolean addResourcesToProject(String projectSystemName, RejectedIdsDto resourcesSuppliersIds, String sessionId)
      Adds resources to a project based on a list of resource supplier IDs. This method updates the project's resources, removing any that are not in the provided list and adding new ones. It ensures that each added resource is valid and updates the project entity accordingly.
      Parameters:
      projectSystemName - The system name of the project to which resources are to be added.
      resourcesSuppliersIds - The DTO containing the list of resource supplier IDs to add to the project.
      sessionId - The session ID of the user performing the operation.
      Returns:
      true if the resources were successfully added to the project, false otherwise.

    • leaveProject

      public String leaveProject(int userId, String projectSystemName, String reason)
      Allows a user to leave a project. This method checks if the user is part of the project and not the creator. It then removes the user from the project and sends notifications and emails to the project's managers informing them of the user's departure.
      Parameters:
      userId - The ID of the user leaving the project.
      projectSystemName - The system name of the project the user is leaving.
      reason - The reason provided by the user for leaving the project.
      Returns:
      A string message indicating the outcome of the operation.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If the user is not in the project or is the project's creator.
